P-EBT provides households with an EBT card funded with the value of the free school breakfast and lunch reimbursement rates for the days that schools have been closed in March, April and May, which equals $5.70 per day. You can receive up to $279 per eligible child to stretch your food budget. The deadline to apply closes on September 23.

As classes begin at all schools this week, please do not forget that students participating in 27J Schools’ in-person learning are required to complete an online health screening prior to arriving at school on days they are scheduled to report for in-person learning.

100% participation is what it will take to make this new system work for everyone. We thank you and look forward to another successful school year in 27J.

With so many aspects of daily life changing, it is easy to forget that you have the opportunity today to shape the future of your schools and community for the next decade.

27J was profiled in the U.S. Census Bureau's recent look at how census participation--and counting young children in particular--is crucial to ensuring schools receive needed funding.

Census Bureau Director Steve Dillingham helps illustrate this. “A kindergartner counted in the #2020Census …will be in high school when the next census comes around in 2030; that’s 10 years of school supplies, teachers, school lunches and school resources that are dependent on ensuring every child is counted.”

If you haven’t done so, make sure to fill out the #2020Census today at 2020census.gov.

------------

To check out the full article by the U.S Census, in which 27J Schools is featured, click below or visit: https://bit.ly/30VYvs0

In response to the postponed opening of Padilla Elementary School, we have announced the appointment of Kevin Purfurst, current Padilla Elementary principal, as the incoming principal of North Elementary School.

Mr. Purfurst will step into this role after Carmella Schroeder, current North Elementary principal, retires at the end of June.

After the completion of the 2020-2021 school-year, 27J Schools plans to officially open Padilla Elementary with Mr. Purfurst serving as principal. All other recently hired Padilla teachers have been reassigned to other schools within the District.

“Kevin has been an absolute pro during this time,” said 27J Schools Superintendent Dr. Chris Fiedler. “As soon as we made the decision to postpone the opening of Padilla Elementary until 2021, Kevin wanted to know what he could do to make sure his staff was placed in other roles throughout the District to keep the Padilla team in 27J Schools until the fall of 2021. He truly is a team player and we are grateful to him for his grace and understanding during this difficult time.”

Simply Pizza Truck
April 16 at 4:48 AM ·

Hello! Like many of you we have been working our day jobs, helping our children with virtual school, running our small business, and reinventing our lives from the ground up. This month we have been focused on providing 125 meals a day to essential staff, pizza kits to those bored at home, as well as searching out grant funding in order to provide more free meal opportunities in our community.

We are focused on our families and creating balance between our business and social responsibility. When all of this began our goal was to make a little and give a lot! With the help of many key community members and organizations we are hopeful that next week we will hit 1200 free meals for those in need! Of course as long as we are in trying times, Simply Pizza will continue to find ways to serve!

Please help us spread the word-we will be popping up next week at South Elementary School! City of Brighton Employees, through Brighton Employee Charities, as well as many community members and other community partners made this event possible!City of Brighton, Colorado Government and 27J Schools

"You’re never too old, too wacky, too wild, to pick up a book and read to a child.” Dr. Seuss

At 27J Schools, we know the most effective way to cultivate children's love of reading is to read with them. Reading aloud helps develop students' vocabularies, builds connections between spoken and written words, increases student's attention span, strengthens cognition, and most importantly provides enjoyment.

Every year, Mary E Pennock Elementary School invites adults from throughout the 27J community to participate in #ReadAcrossAmericaDay, also known as Dr Seuss Day. The day focuses on motivating children to read, and in doing so, improving their performance in school.

Thank you to all this year's guest readers! Today they helped grow children's love for reading. You can too! It is as simple as grabbing a great book and reading with your child.
